name: metabolite profiling assay
description: An assay that detects and identifies chemical entities resulting from biochemical and cellular metabolism

name: transcription profiling assay
description: An assay that determines gene expression and transcription activity using ribonucleic acids collected from a material entity.

name: mass spectrometry assay
description: An assay that identifies the amount and type of material entities present in a sample by fragmenting the sample and measuring the mass-to-charge ratio of the resulting particles.

name: protein expression profiling assay
description: An assay that determines protein expression and translation activity using protein extracts collected from a material entity.

name: enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay
description: An analyte assay where binding of an enzyme linked antibody to a material entity that is immobilized on solid support is detected utilizing a chemiluminescent reaction. Depending on the setup, the enzyme-linked antibody could be binding directly to the analyte, or it serves as a secondary antibody detecting binding of the primary antibody to the analyte.

name: protein expression profiling
description: An analyte assay that detects specific peptides in an input material by separating it using gel electrophoresis, transfering the separated molecules to a membrane, and staining them with_ antibodies specific to the analyte molecules.

name: cell proliferation assay
description: A cytometry assay which measures the degree to which input cells are replicating.

name: real time polymerase chain reaction assay
description: An assay, based on the PCR, that amplifies and simultaneously quantifies a specific DNA molecule based on the use of complementary probes/primers. It enables both detection and quantification (as absolute number of copies or relative amount when normalized to DNA input or additional normalizing genes) of one or more specific sequences in a DNA sample.

name: binding assay
description: An assay with the objective to characterize the disposition of two or more material entities to form a complex.

name: RNA-seq assay
description: An transcription profiling assay that determines an RNA sequence by analyzing the transcibed regions of the genome and or to quantitate transcript abundance.

name: fluorescence detection assay
description: An assay in which a material's fluorescence is determined.

name: immuno staining assay
description: A assay detecting a molecular label assay in which the label is attached to an antibody so that substances are marked based on the antibody's binding specificity.

name: cytometry assay
description: An assay that measures properties of cells.

name: epigenetic modification assay
description: An assay that identifies epigenetic modifications including histone modifications, open chromatin, and DNA methylation.

name: assay for transposase-accessible chromatin using sequencing
description: An assay to capture the location of open chromatin, DNA-binding proteins, individual nucleosomes and chromatin compaction at nucleotide resolution by Tn5 transposase insertion.

name: reporter gene assay
description: An assay that detects expression of a reporter gene that was inserted under the control of a regulatory sequence of interest.

name: fluorescence imaging-based apoptosis assay (provisional OBI term)
fluorescence imaging based cell proliferation assay (provisional OBI term)
description: A cytometry assay which measures the degreee to which input cells are replicating.

fluorescence imaging based reporter gene assay (provisional OBI term)

bead-based immunoassay for protein state (provisional OBI term)
tandem mass spectrometry
description: Tandem mass spectrometry is a data transformation that uses two or more analyzers separated by a region in which ions can be induced to fragment by transfer of energy (frequently by collision with other molecules).
